intro: Galium philippii, commonly known as Philippi's bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and opposite, small ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pinkish flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium philippii is often found in moist soils and is adapted to temperate climates.
